title: "Unspecified Error" 33% or 99% stuck.
body: Since the 6.21 patch came out, this problem has been happening. Please help me fix this problem so I could play my favorite game. I tried re-installing the game and the problem is still occurring. I looked up a lot of YouTube videos about this problem and none of them seem to work. I deleted files and tried to open up the client again. This problem is the biggest problem I have received and I am looking forward for some help to fix this. Thank you.

replies.body:
Issues at or after 33% during patching usually indicate that your patcher is dropping its connection to our patching servers. Follow our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to address the common solutions for this issue.

Let me know if this helped.

I followed the connection guide. I downloaded the Hextech repair tool. I selected "Force Repatch." I clicked start and waited until it was finished. I went to "Task Log" and I scrolled down to find "Force Repatch." Under it, it said, "> Finding latest patch... Done
    Patch Path: 
> Removing latest patch... Failed
  /!\ Error: The syntax of the command is incorrect." 
The Force Repatch failed and it didn't work. Please help and thank you.
Do you still have patching fail after 33% after working through those steps?
No, when I click on league, it's on 33% and then it starts going up. After it goes up for at least 10 minutes, the message pops up.

Gotcha. Well, since the connection guide wasn't able to resolve this, I suggest reaching out to our tech team in a [support request.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) If you attach a set of [Hextech Logs](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to your ticket, it will give the specialist more context on the issue you're experiencing.
I have a "Lol Logs" on my desktop. What do I do after I have that? Is there something I'm supposed to do to fix my problem?

While submitting your ticket with the hyperlink above, it gives you the option to attach logs. Simply attach that zip file with your support ticket and you're good to go. One of our tech specialists will be in touch.
